text: Hans Eysenck (1916â€“1997) was an acclaimed German psychiatrist. He was a behaviorist and a leading opponent of Freudianism. He wrote many books, including attacking Freud called Decline and Fall of the Freudian Empire in 1985. He also wrote Causes and Cures of Criminality.Eysenck, Hans J., Rebel with a Cause (an Autobiography), London: W. H. Allen & Co., 1990 ==References== Category:1919 births Category:1997 deaths Category:German psychiatrists
